intro: Stegnogramma moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan stegnogramma, is a species of flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
